div.pre: 1900 Taranto environs ("Oecist Hoard"), Calabria, c. 1948 Burial: 425-420 B.C. Contents: c. 800? AR Taras: 143 st. (to horsemen, Per. I) Heracleia: 1 st. (as Work 1-2) Laus: 2 st. Metapontum: 58 st. (to Noe 398) Poseidonia: 12 st. (latest signed Α/Α) Sybaris: 9 st. Thurium: 64 st. (incl. 1 with Scylla on helmet) Velia: 2 st. Caulonia: 43 st. (to N. 150-4) Croton: 109 st. (all incuse except 3 rev. tripod in relief, crude style) Terina: 9 st. Disposition: dispersed Kraay, SNR 1970, pp. 58-68
